modName: Requiem Food Patch - Requiem and Realistic Needs and Diseases 2
summary: Patches Requiem with Realistic Needs and Diseases 2 to have the food effect's work together.
descriptionHtml:
[size=6][color=#76a5af][center]Requiem - Food Patch[/center][/color][/size]

[center]This patch is made because of me not being able to find any patch around that lets requiem and RnD2 work together. I've been looking around and only found out i had to use Realistic needs and diseases, but i wanted to use RnD2 therefore i patched. This patch makes all the requiem and RnD2 food effects keep their value. I am no modder and don't claim to be one so don't expect alot from this besides what it suppose to do.[/center][size=6]
[color=#76a5af][i][center]Patched versions:[/center][/i][/color][/size][center][color=#9fc5e8][size=5][i]
[/i][/size][/color][i]Requiem Food Patch[/i]
[size=2]
This patch creates a bridge between Requiem and R&D2.
The foods drinks are giving their effects as it was intended for Requiem.
Because some foods or drinks didn't have a effect yet i also made up some by my self
as i thought it would fit Requiem and R&D2.
[/size]

[color=#9fc5e8][size=5][i]Requiem + Hunterborn Addon[/i][/size][/color]
[size=2]This does the exact same as Requiem Food Patch. 
Its seperate from the Patch so that you have a choice if you want it or not.
Also into Addon/Patch i gave some foods and drinks new effects so it would fit Requiem.
[/size]
[size=5]
[i][color=#3c78d8]Food Patch addon*

[/color][/i][/size][color=#ff0000][s]This is an optional file made because i had some reports of some foods/drinks not having any stamina or magicka effects.[/s]
[s]I gave some RnD2 & Requiem foods effects so it will blend with the gameplay this patch does not require Hunterborn as there will[/s]
[s]be a Patch addon for that in the future. Some food now gives you a disease (raw food). You will still need Realistic Food patch to have to work.[/s]
[s]It will also work with Realistic Food + Hunterborn patch.[/s][/color]
I merged the Food Patch addon with Requiem Food Patch, if you are still using the addon please delete it before using V1.2 of this patch.
I now named Requiem + Hunterborn as addon for users who want to use Hunterborn as well in their modlist.[/center]
[size=6][i][center]Requirements[/center][/i][/size]

[center][size=4][u]For Requiem food patch:[/u][/size]

[size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/78785/?]Realistic Needs and Diseases 2[/url][/size]
[size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/19281/?]Requiem 1.9.4
[/url]Heartfire DLC[/size]
[size=3]Dragonborn DLC[/size]
[list]
[*][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/71214][size=3]Unofficial Skyrim Legendary Edition Patch[/size][/url]
[/list]
[u]
[/u][size=4][u]
For Requiem + Hunterborn Addon:[/u]

[/size][size=3]Requiem Food patch - You are already on the page :)[/size][/center]


[color=#76a5af][size=6][i][center]Notes[/center]

[/i][/size][/color]It should be known that loot or any sorting software is bad for use with requiem i keep the food patch under requiem.esp and do not know if it would work if you keep it above that. Also NMM can mess up your load order sometime's try to use Skyrim's Data files for sorting. Please take note that this is my first time doing something like this and there might be some bugs in here. For the Requiem + Hunterborn Food Patch I used Drinking Fountains of Skyrim so that the water bottle's will be refillable at a quick and lovely spot (i do know RnD2 had fountains integrated). If somehow i forgot to mention a mod or made a mod creator go loco because i used his mod in this patch please i only created this because i got tired of the endless search, and learned my self how to do this in just a day.


[center]
[color=#3d85c6][size=5]Links to usefull patches & mods:

[/size][/color][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/81899/?]Requiem - Complete alchemy and cooking overhaul Patch[/url][/center][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/81899/?]
[/url]
author: Kwando
